Bob Koss [mailto:koss@...] wrote:
>
> On 6/11/02 2:44 AM, "sudipto  chattopadhyay"
> <c_sudipto2002@...>
> wrote:
>
> > is there any way to test gui components using junit. if possible
> > then how can i do? anyone can suggest about this?
> > Sudipto
>
> Sure. But first you have to decide which aspect(s) of the gui you want to
> test. For many people, making the gui so stupid that it can't
> possibly break
> and having it delegate to a class that can be unit tested, is sufficient.

Most GUI's I've seen change their appearance and behavior based on the state
of the underlying objects (widgets enabled/disabled, hidden/shown, values
changed in labels, text, tables etc.). When you are testing it is important
to be able to ensure that the connection between the GUI and the rest of the
code has been defined correctly.
